section.heading: Scope.
section.text: This chapter applies to supplier services to nonresidential customers.

para.text: A supplier may not enroll a customer without the customer's consent.
A customer's choice of gas supplier is the gas supplier with the first enrollment of the customer received by the utility during any given month.
Except as provided under §§B and C of this regulation, a gas company may not terminate service for failure of a customer to pay supplier charges.
If a utility purchases the receivables of a supplier under COMAR 20.59.05.03, the purchased supplier receivables become utility charges for the purpose of termination of service.

If a utility purchases arrearages attributable to a utility as described in COMAR 20.59.05.10D from a supplier providing supplier-consolidated billing services, the purchased arrearages become utility charges for the purpose of termination of service under COMAR 20.31.
Only a person licensed under COMAR 20.54 as a supplier may execute a gas supply contract with a customer.
A supplier contract shall contain all material terms and conditions.
Form and Presentation.

A supplier and the utility shall provide written notice of enrollment to a customer entering into a service agreement with the supplier on the next business day following the supplier's receipt of the utility's enrollment response.
If a customer's billing method changes, the notice of enrollment shall contain a statement that the customer's previous billing providers may still bill the customer for unpaid charges.
A supplier's presentation of a signed copy of the customer's contract at any time before enrollment shall constitute sufficient written notice of enrollment to the customer.
Enrollment Notice Content.
A gas supplier shall provide notice of enrollment of a customer to a utility in a format consistent with the Commission-accepted gas utility supplier coordination agreement.
Notice of enrollment under §B(1) of this regulation shall include the following:
Customer account name;
Customer service address;
Billing name;
Billing address;
Utility name;
Utility account number;
Supplier name;
Supplier identifier;
Commodity provided;
Effective date of the enrollment; and
Whether the customer will receive supplier-consolidated billing service.

Except as provided under §D of this regulation or in a tariff regarding supplier default, a utility may remove a customer from supplier services only if directed by a supplier, subject to applicable bankruptcy law.
A supplier shall process a customer's request to cancel supply services not later than the end of the second utility business day after the customer's cancellation request.
A supplier shall notify the customer's utility of a drop by electronic transaction within the time period specified in §B of this regulation.
Customer Cancellation.

After the third utility business day following a customer request for a supplier to cancel supply service, the customer may contact the utility to verify that the cancellation request submitted by the supplier has been processed by the utility.
If a customer's cancellation request has not been processed by the customer's utility, and the customer requests cancellation of supplier service, the utility shall process a cancellation.
Supplier-Consolidated Billing — Nonpaying Customer.
A supplier providing supplier-consolidated billing services shall provide a nonpaying customer a minimum of 3 days notice before cancellation of the customer's contract.
A supplier's notice to a nonpaying customer under §E(1) of this regulation shall include:
The total amount due;
The date by which the payment is due to the supplier;
The date on or after which the supplier will transmit the drop request to the utility if payment is not received;
Notice that the customer may still receive gas supply from the supplier until the end of the current month or the next month after the customer is dropped; and
The telephone number at which the supplier representatives who handle payment arrangements, payment plans, and customer complaints may be reached.
A customer may designate a third party to receive a notice of drop for nonpayment as required in §E(2) of this regulation on the customer's behalf.

section.heading: Rescission Period.
section.text: A supplier is not required to offer a contract rescission period except where required by law.
